莖字的基本解释

莖
jìng
见“茎”。

莖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jīng］
［《廣韻》户耕切，平耕，匣。］
“茎1”的繁体字。
(1)植物体的一部分，由胚芽发展而成，下部和根连接，上部一般都生有枝叶花果。茎能输送水分和养料以支持枝叶花果的生长。一般多直立生长于地面，也有攀援茎、匍匐茎等，此外还有地下茎，如球茎、鳞茎等。
(2)指直立的柱或竿。
(3)器物的柄。
(4)量词。用于称长条形的东西。

莖字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　莖； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1034第09
【唐韻】戸耕切【集韻】【韻會】何耕切【正韻】何庚切，?音牼。【說文】草木榦也。【字林】枝柱也。【類篇】草曰莖，竹曰箇，木曰枚。【楚辭·九歌】秋蘭兮靑靑，綠葉兮紫莖。【繁露·竹林篇】凡《春秋》之記災異也，雖畝有數莖，猶謂之無麥苗也。【論衡】朱草之莖如鍼。　又特也。【張衡·西京賦】徑百常而莖擢。　又【周禮·冬官·桃氏】以其臘廣爲之莖，圍長倍之。【註】莖謂劒夾，人所握鐔以上也。　又樂名。【白虎通】顓頊樂曰《六莖》，者莖，著萬物也。【左思·魏都賦】冒六英五莖。　又山名。【韓詩外傳】秦穆公將田而喪其馬，求三日而得之於莖山之陽。　又【廣韻】烏莖切【直音】於京切，?音鶯。草名。【爾雅·釋草】姚莖，凃薺。　【六書正譌】別作䪫，非。

考證：〔【白虎通】顓頊樂曰六莖莖者著萬物也〕　謹照原文莖者改者莖。

小篆楷体

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
stem
jìng

stem
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jīng］
["Guangyun" household farming cut, flat farming, box. ]
The traditional characters of "枝1".
(1) A part of the plant body, developed from the embryo, the lower part is connected with the root, and the upper part generally has branches, leaves, flowers and fruits. The stems can transport water and nutrients to support the growth of branches, leaves, flowers and fruits. Generally, they grow upright on the ground, and there are also climbing stems, stolons, etc., in addition to underground stems, such as bulbs and bulbs.
(2) Refers to an upright post or pole.
(3) The handle of the utensil.
(4) Quantifiers. Used to weigh long strips.
stem
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zong Zi] 　 Stem; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1034 Page 09
[Tang Yun] 戸 Gengqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] He Gengqie [Zheng Yun] He Gengqie,? Yin Su. [Said the text] The vegetation is dry. [Word Lin] Branches and pillars. 【Classes】Grass refers to stems, bamboo refers to scorpions, and wood refers to pieces. [Songs of the Chu·Nine Songs] Qiulan is beautiful, green leaves are purple stems. 【Fanlu·Bamboo Forest】Everything in "Spring and Autumn" records disasters, although there are several stems in an acre, it can be said that there is no wheat seedlings. 【Lunheng】The stems of Zhu grass are like needles.　It's so special. [Zhang Heng·Xijing Fu] The diameter is constant and the stems are stalked.　[Zhou Li·Dongguan·Taoshi】With its wax wide as the stem, the girth is twice as long. [Note] The stem is called a clip, and it is also above the grip of a person.　Also known as music. [Baihutong] Zhuan Xuyue said "Six Stems", the stems are all things. [Zuo Si·Wei Du Fu] Take six English and five stems.　Also the name of the mountain. [Han Shiwai Biography] Qin Mugong mourned the field and lost his horse, seeking three days to get it in the sun of Jianshan.　[Guangyun] Wu Stem cut [Straight tone] cut in Beijing,? Yin Ying. Cursive name. 【Erya·Shuicao】Yao stem, painted water chestnut.　【Six Books Zhengzheng】Don’t behave, no. Textual research: [[Baihutong] Zhuan Xuyue said that those with six stems and stems are all things] 　 I would like to change the stems according to the original.
